snippet: The Obama administration announced its most significant steps to date to normalize relations, lifting the travel ban on some of the country’s senior leaders and easing sanctions.
abstract: Obama administration announces its most significant moves yet to open relations with Myanmar, lifting the travel ban on its senior leaders and easing some sanctions that have starved the country of most American investments for more than two decades; only days after special elections the administration says it will reopen a United States Agency for International Development office, clearing the way for an expansion of foreign assistance.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and THOMAS FULLER
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and Thomas Fuller from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced its most significant steps to date to normalize relations, lifting the travel ban on some of the country’s senior leaders and easing sanctions.

headline.main: U.S. Moves Toward Normalizing Relations With Myanmar
headline.print_headline: U.S. Moves Toward Normalizing Relations With Myanmar
